headline: Matthijs de Ligt 'faces prison or fine' if found guilty of alleged hit-and-run at Bayern training ground
body: Bayern Munich defender Matthijs de Ligt is reported to be under investigation on suspicion of being involved in an alleged hit-and-run around the German side's premises on Wednesday morning
Manchester United target Matthijs de Ligt is being investigated 'on suspicion of a hit-and-run' near Bayer Munich's training ground.

BILD claims the 24-year-old collided with a parked car close to the club's Sabener Strasse premises on Wednesday morning, where a witness recognised the Dutchman and contacted police. De Ligt was said to be driving his Audi Q8 e-tron, worth in the region of £63,000.

The German outlet claims that De Ligt's car was towed and impounded after the 24-year-old had, allegedly, 'simply drove away'. A fine or prison sentence could yet await the Netherlands international, if he is found guilty.
"If convicted, you face up to three years in prison or a fine. Fines are often imposed when people are convicted of such crimes," lawyer Marc Wederhake told BILD.

Katharina Thueuerkaufer, a specialist lawyer for criminal and traffic law suggested it would need to be proven that De Ligt was aware he was involved in the collision before driving away. Intention is required to be found guilty of a hit-and-run.
She told BILD: "A hit-and-run can only be committed intentionally. Now it must be proven that he perceived the accident acoustically, visually or tangibly."

De Ligt was left out of Bayern's squad that travelled to South Korea earlier this summer. The former Ajax and Juventus defender has been widely expected to leave the Allianz Arena with Manchester United appearing to the most prominent suitor.

Erik ten Hagconfirmed United's interestlast month. T he 54-year-old told Dutch newspaperAlgemeen Dadblad : ''We still have to wait and see whether De Ligt will come. But the good thing is, during my vacation I was out of the process for three or four weeks.

"During that period it was really the club, the newly established scouting and recruitment department, that brought in these players. The fact that there are also Dutch players among them is actually a coincidence.
"Primarily these were players who were brought in by our organisation. But of course I support them, let that be clear – and we still make the choice together."
Bayern chief Max Eberl has been coy over De Ligt's possible departure. "I will comment on the reasons when the time comes," he told Sky Sports Germany.

"It is not yet that time. Matthijs played very well here for two years and that is why many fans like him. Nevertheless, you have to think about how you decide and also how the boy feels. He is still a player for FC Bayern. And as long as he is, he will get all the support from us."

headline: Man Utd get huge £40m transfer boost as Tottenham 'shake hands on club-record deal’
body: Manchester United's hopes of signing Brentford's Ivan Toney have been given a boost with Tottenham closing in on a club-record deal for Bournemouth ace Dominic Solanke
Manchester United have been given a free run at Ivan Toney amid news Tottenham are on the verge of signing Dominic Solanke.

With Rasmus Hojlund sidelined for six weeks, the Red Devils are considering bringing in another striker and are eying up a move for Toney. The Brentford star, 28, could be up for grabs for as little as £40million as his contract with the Bees expires next summer.

Previously, Toney had been linked with Arsenal, Chelsea and Tottenham, but with Arsenal pursuing other options, Chelsea on the brink of signing Atletico Madrid's Samu Omorodion, and Spurs keen on Solanke, United's hopes of landing the England international have been given a major boost.

According to The Athletic, Solanke has agreed personal terms with Tottenham, who are close to finalising a potential club-record deal for the 26-year-old. The ex-Chelsea and Liverpool forward has a £65m release clause in his Bournemouth contract and it's believed Spurs are willing to offer a sum near that figure.

The north London side have yet to find a replacement for Harry Kane a year after his £100m transfer to Bayern Munich. However, based on recent comments by Ange Postecoglou, the delay appears to be due to Tottenham simply waiting for the right candidate.

"What's important is the type of striker we get. You know we play a certain way," the Spurs boss said during their pre-season tour of Japan. "We demand certain things from a physical perspective from the technical aspects of it that it's going be a striker that fits that mould.
"It's still the area of the park we're really probably the thinnest when I talk about squad-wise at the moment, so obviously that's a focus for us."

United, meanwhile, aren't in dire need of a new centre forward, especially after shelling out £36m on Joshua Zirkzee last month. However, with Hojlund sidelined for a couple of months, Erik ten Hag only has one fit striker at his disposal and the club might deem a £40m offer for Toney too good to refuse.

Ten Hag usually prefers to field a team with a single centre forward, which suggests that Hojlund, Zirkzee and Toney would all be vying for the same role. But considering Hojlund's patchy performances last season, there's no reason why either Toney or Zirkzee couldn't snatch that spot from him.

Last season, Toney scored just four goals in 17 games for Brentford, though his season was hampered by an eight-month betting ban, which ran from May 2023 until January 2024. He played a bit-part role for England at Euro 2024, though came off the bench to set up Kane's winner in the last-16 against Slovakia, and also scored a penalty in the quarter-final shootout victory over Switzerland.

headline: Man Utd star Antony hits back at critics and explains struggles since £86m transfer
body: Manchester United winger Antony has struggled since moving to Old Trafford from Ajax in an £86million transfer two summers ago but he insists he is ready to repay Erik ten Hag's faith this season
Antony has vowed to finally show why Manchester United paid £85million for him – after failing to deliver last season.

The Brazil winger managed just three goals from 38 appearances in a season to forget for the 24-year-old, who faced widespread criticism for his woeful form. Antony faced allegations of physical assault from a former girlfriend at the start of last season and voluntarily attended an interview with Greater Manchester Police.

He was dropped from the Brazil squad because of the allegations and given a month-long personal leave of absence by United to deal with the situation. Even when he returned for United in October, he failed to get anywhere close to justifying his inflated fee and continued to fall way short of expectations.

But after a summer off – he was omitted from Brazil's Copa America squad – and a full pre-season, Antony is determined to show United fans his very best. “I'm someone who demands a lot of myself,” said Antony.

“I was not satisfied with my season, but a lot happened over the year in my personal life. Like it or not, everything I went through had an effect on the pitch. As I've said before, that's behind me now and now it's a new season.

“I've got a strong mentality and I'm focused on what I want and I know that this season will be totally different. Everything I went through was very difficult for me and all my family. I've learnt from it all, I've grown and matured.
“I believe I learnt a lot from the adversity. I learn from everything I go through and learn that everything is possible when you persist in achieving what you want.
“I matured and grew from it all and this will make me stronger going into this new season. New season, new mindset. I feel a lot less burdened and more prepared.”

Antony, who played under United boss Erik ten Hag at Ajax, revealed he keeps a written journal of his objectives and what he must improve on as a player. “I have a lot of objectives, ones I write down for myself,” said Antony. “I definitely need more goal participations and to score more.

“Rest assured, you'll hear the name Antony in relation to goals and assists. I always set out objectives. I put them down on paper, rather than on my phone. It allows me to visualise things and to then step onto the pitch with this in mind.”

Antony said he also draws on his tough upbringing, in a Sao Paulo favela, for inspiration whenever he faces adversity, like last season. “I talked about the difficult times I went through last year, but I've overcome more significant difficulties in the favela,” said Antony.

headline: West Ham target jets in for medical after transfer hijack with Man Utd talks ongoing
body: West Ham are now closing in on the signing of Nice defender Jean-Clair Todibo after the Frenchman lost patience holding out for a move to Italian giants Juventus
Jean-Clair Todibo is set to undergo a medical at West Ham following a sensational transfer hijack from Hammers technical director Tim Steidten.

Last month, the Irons agreed a loan-to-buy deal with Nice for the 24-year-old Frenchman worth just shy of £28m but the former Manchester United target snubbed the move as he intended to hold out for the Italian giants.
However, despite weeks of discussions and negotiations, Juve have been able to match Nice's demands and the player has lost patience - allowing West Ham to pounce.

Julen Lopetegui's side are now set to land Todibo on an initial loan with a buy-option worth in the region of £34m (€40m). Nice have also successfully negotiated a sell-on clause that will entitle them to future profit.
West Ham thought they had lost out on Todibo altogether when he made it abundantly clear he wanted to play Champions League football.

But he has remained a top target for Lopetegui, Steidten, David Sullivan and sporting director Mark Noble all summer and they have continued to work on convincing the player to join the club in the background as his preferred move to Juventus stalled.

Steidten flew to France to close the deal on Thursday and Todibo is understood to have joined him on his return flight to London to undergo a medical check after an agreement was reached on personal terms.

West Ham have pulled no punches in the transfer market this summer having already landed Wolves captain Max Kilman, exciting 18-year-old Brazilian attacker Luis Guilherme from Palmeiras, free agent goalkeeper Wes Foderingham, Leeds United star Crysencio Summerville, Borussia Dortmund frontman Niclas Fullkrug and World Cup winner Guido Rodriguez.
Talks also remain ongoing with Manchester United over a move for right-back Aaron Wan-Bissaka, who is into the final year of his Old Trafford deal.
Wan-Bissaka is reportedly demanding a potential pay-off from United as he is due to give up the final year of his contract and would therefore miss out on a loyalty bonus.

He was prominent figure throughout Erik ten Hag side's pre-season tour of the United States due to a shortage of numbers. However, the Red Devils are still open to business as there has been no agreement with the player over a contract extension.
Initially, there had also been doubt that Wan-Bissaka would agree to a move to east London but personal terms are not expected to be a problem if the two clubs can agree a fee.
It's believed the Hammers have already seen one bid rejected but they remain close to reaching United's valuation which is thought to be in the region of £15m.

headline: Paul Scholes urges Man Utd to sign £40m upgrade on Rasmus Hojlund and Joshua Zirkzee
body: Manchester United have already spent heavily when it comes to strikers this summer but Red Devils icon Paul Scholes wants to see the club dip into the market once again to take the pressure off of Rasmus Hojlund
Paul Scholes has appealed for Manchester United to make a move for Brentford ’s Ivan Toney despite having already signed Joshua Zirkzee.

The Red Devils have been busy in the transfer market when it comes to strikers over recent seasons. Rasmus Hojlund was signed from Atalanta 12 months ago for £72m and he enjoyed a promising debut campaign.

United have bolstered their frontline even further this summer with the signing of Bologna’s Joshua Zirkzee. But Scholes still does not believe that is enough for the coming campaign and has urged the Red Devils hierarchy to move for Brentford frontman Toney.
Speaking on The Overlap Fan Debate, he said: "You have got to look at the forward players. Could Hojlund score 25 goals for us this season? I would be amazed, I’d be surprised.
"You look at someone like Ivan Toney if he could come to us. Could he score 25 goals? I think he could.

"I think he [Hojlund] is really good but he has been brought into this country at 19 [21] years of age and he has been asked to be the No.9 for Man United. It is an iconic role for players who are scoring 20, 25, 30 goals and winning league titles.

"He should be a second, third or fourth-choice striker at a big club. They have brought in [Joshua] Zirkzee and I will be honest, I have never seen him play. I think goals will be a problem. I look at Zirkzee and I don’t think he has been a great goalscorer wherever he has been.
"He has got almost 40 goals in something like 150 games [48 goals in 143 appearances] which, coming to the Premier League, is only going to get more difficult."
Toney could potentially be on the move sooner rather than later. He has just one year remaining on his contract with Brentford.

And it appears that the Red Devils are in the running for his services should he choose to move on. Reports this week have suggested that they still hold an interest in him despite having already signed Zirkzee.

Should Toney arrive at Old Trafford over the coming weeks, it would certainly alleviate a troublesome headache for Erik ten Hag heading into the new season. Hojlund is ruled out for the next few weeks having picked up an injury in pre-season. Ten Hag has also suggested that Zirkzee still needs time to adapt so is unlikely to start in the Red Devils’ Premier League opener against Fulham.

headline: Man Utd transfers: Ivan Toney interest revisited as Matthijs de Ligt concerns emerge
body: Manchester United have made two major signings so far this summer and more new faces could be on their way to Old Trafford before the transfer window closes later this month
Manchester United have enjoyed a busy summer and in the transfer market and there could be more movement at Old Trafford before the window slams shut at the end of the month.

United have added striker Joshua Zirkzee and defender Leny Yoro to their ranks, but the latter has already been sidelined through injury. There have also been some notable outgoings, with the likes of Raphael Varane, Anthony Martial, Donny van de Beek and Mason Greenwood all departing.
United are moving in a new direction under Sir Jim Ratcliffe, who has taken full control of football operations, and here is all the latest transfer news from Old Trafford.
According to Forbes, Manchester United are revisiting their interest in Brentford's Ivan Toney after striker Rasmus Hojlund suffered an injury that will see him miss the start of the season.

The report states that United 'remain interested' in the England international, who is entering the final year of his contract. Brentford are said to be 'determined not to lose him on a free' at the end of the season and could be tempted to sell him for £40m this summer.
United have already signed Zirkzee from Bologna, but the Netherlands international has not featured at all in pre-season after taking an extended break following Euro 2024.
United legend Paul Scholes has highlighted a "massive concern" about the club's pursuit of Matthijs de Ligt, claiming the Dutchman is "like a second-rate defender now".

In an appearance on The Overlap, Scholes said: "From Bayern Munich, he has not played for them. That has to be a big concern for me, especially when Eric Dier is playing in front of him. I'm not joking though, that is a massive concern for me.

"When you're bringing players in for £40-£50million just because he played for him three or four years ago. Juventus got rid of him, he wasn't good enough for Juventus. He's obviously not been good enough at Bayern Munich, so he's coming to us as like a second-rate defender now."
Arsenal wonderkid Chido Obi-Martin is expected to join United this summer, but there is still work to do before the deal can be finalised.

The 16-year-old striker has agreed a deal to join United after his Arsenal contract expired, but the Athletic are reporting that the move has been delayed as Obi-Martin's age mean the two clubs are negotiating an exit price.

The report states that both clubs are expecting to 'reach a positive conclusion' and that the deal will not have to be settled at a Premier League tribunal. Once a fee is agreed, the Premier League will need to ratify the move and that could delay the transfer for several more weeks.

headline: Man Utd forced into transfer U-turn after suffering pre-season injury crisis
body: Manchester United had considered selling defender Will Fish depending on how their own transfer business went but an injury to the youngster means he is due to remain at Old Trafford
Manchester United defender Will Fish suffered a serious injury during the club's pre-season tour which effectively rules out any possible exit from Old Trafford.

The centre-half was someway down the pecking order and had been linked with a switch to a Championship outfit. United had made it clear, following the major setback to Leny Yoro, which rules him out for months, that Fish would only be allowed to seek pastures new if they landed a new defender.

Now though, after he suffered torn ligaments which is set to sideline him for up to five weeks, Fish's hopes of leaving Manchester are all but over, reports the MEN. The 21-year-old has entered the final year of his deal but the Red Devils have the option of another 12 months.

United manager Erik ten Hag walked onto the pitch to check on Fish’s well-being immediately after he suffered his injury blow at the weekend and it is understood he had a scan on his return to Carrington on Monday. Sources say Fish did not suffer a fracture and the prognosis is better than the player had expected.

The trip across the Atlantic proved to be a nightmare in terms of the squad's fitness. Five of the club's senior centre backs suffered either an injury or illness during their tour. Harry Maguire was left out of the Liverpool game as a precaution, Victor Lindelof was taken off at half-time for the same reason and Jonny Evans came off at the same time as he was unwell.

That is alongside the injury suffered by Rasmus Hojlund, which leaves United light in the final third. The Dane had led the line for almost the entirety of last season and faces around two months out.

Fish has spent the last two years largely out on loan at Hibernian with his only competitive appearance for United coming at Wolves back in May 2021 - before Ten Hag even arrived. The academy graduate appeared in all five of United’s pre-season friendlies but will now have to work his way back into contention.

By the time he returns United could have further bolstered their backline. Matthijs de Ligt has been linked with a move to Old Trafford for much of the summer. The Bayern Munich defender previously worked under Ten Hag at Ajax and the German club are open to selling.

England international Jarrad Branthwaite is also on their shortlist with his stock rising at Everton. Already United have seen two bids for the Toffees defender rejected as they hold out for £70million. Currently the best offer from Manchester has been £50m.

headline: David de Gea finally set for return to football with European finalists after 12-month absence
body: David de Gea has been without a club since June 2023 after leaving Manchester United but finally looks set to make his return in Serie A with Fiorentina and has a medical planned
David de Gea has agreed to join Serie A side Fiorentina as he looks to bring an end to his 12-month exodus from football.

The Spanish goalkeeper has been without a club since seeing his Manchester United contract expired at the end of 2022/23. Now, according to reports, De Gea will make the move to La Viola on a contract until June 2025 with the option for a further season.

The 33-year-old has made a verbal agreement to join the club with his medical booked ahead of the move. The veteran shotstopper had fielded interest from the likes of the Saudi Pro League and the MLS.

Last month, it appeared that De Gea was going to make the move to another Serie A side. Genoa had entered talks with the former Atletico Madrid goalkeeper but ultimately the parties could not come to a final agreement.

De Gea brought a 545-match, 12-year stint with United to a close in 2023 and initially took a break from football before working towards a return. It is understood that De Gea has snubbed offers over the last year but he now appears set to feature in the Italian top flight.

De Gea spent time training at nonleague side Altrincham as he bid to maintain his fitness and skills. The Madrid-born star looks set to return to a professional set-up should he come through his medical without issue.

It is report that the Spaniard has demanded a £2.5million-a-year salary, that could rise to £3.5m if his stay is extended. De Gea will follow Marin Pngracic, Moise Kean and Andrea Colpani in signing for the Italian side this summer.

Fiorentina once again enter the Europa Conference League this season having fallen short as finalists in the previous two editions of the competition. The Florence-based side fell to West Ham in 2022/23 when Jarrod Bown scored a 90th-minute winner.
The Italians were unable to overcome Olympiacos more recently. The Greek giants were able to earn a 1-0 win after extra time thanks to Ayoub El Kaabi's effort and claimed their first European trophy.
De Gea's final match for United also came in a cup defeat. The Red Devils lost the FA Cup final to Manchester City 2-1, as Ilkay Gundogan scored the final's fastest ever goal after 12 seconds.
United earned revenge in 2023/24 by winning the showpiece event after goals from Kobbie Mainoo and Alejandro Garnacho.

headline: Man Utd suffer Matthijs de Ligt transfer hammer blow amid defensive injury crisis
body: Manchester United are still in search of a central defender in the transfer market and have already been hit by an injury to new signing Leny Yoro ahead of the season starting
Manchester United are set to see their bid to sign Matthijs de Ligt undergo complications, after Bayern Munich decided against signing Jonathan Tah.

The Bayer Leverkusen defender was expected to join the German giants after an impressive season under Xabi Alonso, winning the Bundesliga. Bayern's ambitious recruitment will have hoped to overturn the gap to the Spaniard's side, but now they appear to have chosen not to action the move.

Bayern are set to let a deadline set by Leverkusen pass, despite there being a verbal agreement for a transfer fee. The club's hierarchy are said to have not been convinced by Max Eberl's desire to land the defender.

It had been suggested Bayern needed to sell before making new signings but Matthijs de Ligt's situation is said to be separate. The Dutchman is expected to be sold with United and Erik ten Hag admirers of the 24-year-old.

Tah will not move to Bayern regardless of a sale being made to raise funds however. That would appear to be a complicating factor for De Ligt if Die Roten are not content with their stock of defenders.
That could prove problematic at Old Trafford. Ten Hag is already been forced to deal with injury concerns this summer. His backline has not escaped.
New signing Leny Yoro has been ruled out for three months, while Harry Maguire is currently not fit. Victor Lindelof is also a doubt for United's Commuinty Shield clash with Man City.
“Harry Maguire missed the game as a precaution,” Ten Hag explained “There’s still a question mark for Saturday. We have training and we have to see whether he is fit enough or not to be available.
“Victor played, but also he’s a question mark and also Azza (Wan-Bissaka) and Luke Shaw are both question mark. We have to assess them tomorrow.”
That leaves the club with only Lisandro Martinez and Jonny Evans to form a central pairing. Ten Hag Hag has noted the club are ready to move in the transfer market if required.
"You’ve seen the market it’s quite quiet but we have done two deals,"he said. "It’s about timing and the market options. In the right moment do the right things.
"I don’t go into details of where we are now with recruitment and what we’re working on. Of course, we know what we’re doing, we’re in a good position with the squad and wait with patience."

headline: Man Utd hit with injury crisis before season even starts as SIX first-team stars crocked
body: Lisandro Martinez and Jonny Evans may form United’s centre-half partnership because they have no-one else and Ten Hag says he will not take risks at Wembley
Manchester United have been hit by yet another injury crisis before the season has even started.

Erik ten Hag claims there are doubts over Harry Maguire, Victor Lindelof, Aaron Wan-Bissaka and Luke Shaw for Saturday’s Community Shield against Manchester City at Wembley. United are already without Leny Yoro and Rasmus Hojlund through injury before they have kicked a ball in anger.
Maguire missed last weekend’s friendly defeat to Liverpool in South Carolina and ten Hag says the England centre-half is one of several doubts.

“Harry Maguire missed the game as a precaution,” said the United boss. “There’s still a question mark for Saturday. We have training and we have to see whether he is fit enough or not to be available.
“Victor played, but also he’s a question mark and also Azza (Wan-Bissaka) and Luke Shaw are both question mark. We have to assess them tomorrow.”

Lisandro Martinez and Jonny Evans may form United’s centre-half partnership because they have no-one else and Ten Hag says he will not take risks at Wembley. He says although he wants to beat City again at Wembley, like they did in the FA Cup Final, he will not endanger anyone.
“We always want to win, also in all the friendlies,” he said. “It’s about trophy. We will put out a team that is very competitive to win this trophy.
“But it’s also pre-season and we don’t take risks with players. That’s the normal approach to this game.”

Several United players, such as Kobbie Mainoo, met up with their team-mates at Carrington this week after missing their pre-season tour to the US and ten Hag says they have all had bespoke training programmes to try and get them up to speed.
“That is individual based,” he said. “Everyone has a different background. We put them on off-season programmes, but they have had different starts while we were in USA.

The Premier League's return is a week away and the transfer window is heating up with less than three weeks until it shuts.
Tottenham appear set to smash their transfer record by signing Bournemouth striker Dominic Solanke. The Cherries are said to be considering former Chelsea forward Tammy Abraham as a replacement.

Martin Zubimendi has been identified as a key target but work remains on a potential Anfield switch.

That doesn’t mean there won’t be outgoings of certain players.”
Liverpool defender Billy Koumetio is set to join Scottish Premiership side Dundee United.
The 21-year-old is set to move on a permanent deal with the Reds looking to secure a fee before his contract expires next summer.
Koumetio joined Liverpool in 2018 from US Orleans.
Pep Guardiola has admitted he may have to dip into the transfer market before the window closes to fill the void left by Julian Alvarez.
The Argentina star is set to complete a move to Atletico Madrid in a deal that could reach £81m.
Guardiola did not want to stand in the way of Alvarez and is open to making a signing.

Conor Gallagher is set to sign his Atlético Madrid contract this afternoon. The midfielder has already done some light training with players that did not fly to Hong Kong for pre-season tour. Gallagher is expected to meet the squad and Diego Simeone later today.
The England international could make his debut vs Juventus on Sunday.
The Spurs boss was tight-lipped over the move despite the momentum building towards Solanke heading to north Lond.
"It’s a bit like the chancellor of exchequer speaking, if I speak, stock markets will crash or social media will go into meltdown if I start speculating about things," the Aussia said.

"We still have work to do in the transfer window and hopefully those things will get resolved. It’s difficult for me as I have no control over it or be definite about it. I’m hopeful over the next few days there will be resolutions in terms of ins and outs."
Fabrizio Romano reports that Wolves hope to land Carlos Forbs from Ajax with Neto set to move to Chelsea.
The 20-year-old winger has already featured in three Europa League qualifying matches this summer after scoring four goals and providing five assists last term.
Liverpool goalkeeper Caoimhin Kelleher is facing a major decision over his future with Juventus interested in him.
The Italian giants are in the market for a new goalkeeper and see the Irish international as an option. They have scouted him on a number of occasions, according to The Sun.
Liverpool are expected to demand around £30m for Kelleher, who has two years remaining on his contract.
Middlesbrough have confirmed that they have sealed a deal for Man City academy graduate Micah Hamilton.
He has penned a four-year deal at the Riverside after leaving the Etihad Stadium.

Middlesbrough boss Michael Carrick said: "Micah is an exciting young player who we're looking forward to working with. He's already been in and around the senior side at Man City - he's got that experience from playing in the Champions League - and he is another great addition to the squad."
Things move quickly! David Ornstein has now reported that Wolves and Chelsea have agreed a package worth €60m with a further €3m in add-ons.
Hello, Barcelona pic.twitter.com/vzDNuKUkji
The Blues are not done in the transfer market yet it seems. Fabrice Hawkins claims that Wolves star Pedro Neto is nearing a move to Stamford Bridge.
The player is keen to make the move while negotiations are close between the two Premier League teams.

Tammy Abraham is expected to be among the names Bournemouth consider in their quest to replace Tottenham-bound Dominic Solanke.Spurs are in advanced talks with the Cherries over a £60million swoop for the England international, who already has a broad agreement in place on personal terms with Ange Postecoglou's side.
One name that is expected to form part of their extensive search is Roma striker Abraham, who is keen on a return to the Premier League after spending three seasons in Serie A.
Norwich have slapped a £15million pricetag on striker Jonathan Rowe in a bid to ward off Leeds.
Leeds are targeting Rowe as they consider replacements for Crysencio Summerville and are understood to have made inquiries to their Championship rivals.
Norwich do not want to lose Rowe, who scored 13 goals in his breakthrough campaign last season, after selling Gabriel Sara to Galatasaray for £22.5million.
Rowe, 21, has entered the final year of his Norwich deal, although the Canaries have the option to extend it by a further 12 months.
Former Man United goalkeeper David De Gea has arrived in Florence ahead of finally finding a new club.
The Spanish goalkeeper is set to sign for Serie A side Fiorentina.
Should the deal be completed, that would see him return to football for the first time since his Old Trafford exit last year.
Chelsea have allowed goalkeeper Eddie Beach to depart to join Crawley Town.
He pens a season-long loan deal with the League One side.
Beach has previouslt had spells with Chelmsford and Gateshead.
Brighton have confirmed the sale of striker Dennis Undav.
The German makes a permanent move to Stuttgart after spending last season on loan with the Bundesliga side, netting 19 goals.

Technical director David Weir said: “Deniz wants to play Champions League football and continue his time with VfB Stuttgart, and while we would liked to have kept him as part of the squad, his preference was to make his move permanent.

“Once he’d made that clear, our priority was to ensure that Stuttgart met the valuation of the player. That’s now been achieved and we would like to thank Deniz for his time at the club and wish him well for the future.”
Brighton have earned around €30m from the deal.
Manchester United will have to pay £30million for Sander Berge if they want to prise the Norway midfielder away from Burnley.

United have made enquiries about Berge as they look to sign a midfielder after cooling their interest in Paris St Germain’s Manuel Ugarte. Burnley paid Sheffield United £15million for Berge, when he had just a year left on his Blades deal, and feel his value has doubled in 12 months.

The Clarets will not block Berge’s return to the Premier League, but are determined to get full value for the 26-year-old if he does leave. United are considering their midfield options and they are also looking at Monaco’s Youssof Fofana.

Marseille are trying to hijack Leeds' bid to sign Norwich attacker Jonathan Rowe.The 21-year-old England U21 international scored 12 goals in the Championship last season and has also been monitored by Lazio. But earlier this week, Leeds opened talks over a £7million swoop for the Canaries ace after selling Crysencio Summerville to West Ham.However, French giants Marseille, now managed by ex-Brighton boss Roberto De Zerbi, have now registered their interest in the forward. Rowe is into the final 12 months of his current deal at Carrow Road meaning Norwich will reluctantly be forced to consider offers for the player.
The Canaries begin their Championship campaign on Saturday when they travel to newly-promoted side Oxford United.
Jude Soonsup-Bell has been given the green light to leave Tottenham permanently this summer.
The versatile forward, 20, joined Spurs from Chelsea back in January 2023 after impressing at youth level but is about to enter the final year of his contract.
Mirror Football understands that Spurs will allow Soonsup-Bell to move on a permanent basis should the right opportunity present itself and the player has suitors in both the UK and overseas.
Soonsup-Bell, who was previously expected to head out on loan, impressed for Tottenham's Under-21 team last season, scoring 10 goals and assisting a further seven.
Matias Soule has suggested the influence of Roma boss Daniele De Rossi saw him spurn a move to Leicester.

Speaking to Corriere dello Sport, he said: “Initially it was mine [Premier League dream] too. Leicester wanted me so much, both the coach and the sporting director called me to convince me of their project.

“But then I felt the affection of De Rossi, of Roma, of the teammates who contacted me and I decided from that moment to say no to all the other clubs and to think only of Roma for all these reasons plus one.”
Soule eventually left Juventus for Roma.
Aston Villa have rejected an opening offer for Brazilian defender Diego Carlos.
According to The Athletic, Fulham have tabled their opening bid but have been rebuffed. There is also reportedly interest in him from Saudi Arabia.
Liverpool are set to bid farewell to youngster Billy Koumetio.
According to Mail Online, the youngster is set to join Scottish side Dundee in a permanent deal. His contract is set to expire next summer and Liverpool have opted to sell.
Koumetio was previously hailed by Jurgen Klopp and spent last season on loan with French side Dunkerque and then with Blackburn in the Championship.
Arsenal are reportedly set to make an offer for Real Sociedad star Mikel Merino.

According to Noticias de Gipuzkoa, the Gunners will submit their opening offer for the Spanish midfielder over the next few days. They have been nudged into action by Liverpool's move for teammate Martin Zubimendi.
Arsenal are reportedly 'nervous' that Socieded will no longer sell Merino should Zubimendi move to Anfield.
Staying in London, West Ham have reportedly agreed a deal to sign Nice defender Jean-Clair Todibo.
The Hammers have thrashed out a loan deal with an option to buy for £35m, according to Sky Sports. Todibo is anticipated to undergo a medical on Friday.
Todibo was previously a target for Juventus and Man United. Todibo will be drafted in as a replacement for captain Kurt Zouma, who is set for a move to the UAE.
Tottenham look set to smash their transfer record with the signing of Bournemouth striker Dominic Solanke.
According to The Athletic, the North London side are set to sign the striker. Talks are ongoing between the clubs to thrash out a deal.
Solanke has already agreed personal terms and is keen to move to Tottenham. Solanke scored 21 goals in all competitions for the Cherries last season.
Sticking in the East-Midlands, it appears that Nottingham Forest are also attempting to bolster their attacking options.
According to Sky Sports, the Reds have seen a bid rejected for Porto winger Galeno and are considering whether to up their offer.
Porto apparently want to receive around in excess of £30m but Forest have alternatives should they not want to go up that high.
Leicester City are reportedly set to make Brighton's Facundo Buonanotte their fourth signing of the summer transfer window.
According to Mail Online, the Argentine is set to move to the King Power Stadium on a season-long loan deal. There will be no option or obligation to buy.
Leicester have already signed Bobby Decordova-Reid, Michael Golding, Abdul Fatawu and Caleb Okoli this summer upon their return to the Premier League.
Ex-Manchester United goalkeeper David De Gea may finally be set to return to football over a year after leaving Old Trafford.

The Spanish stopper has been a free agent since June 2023 having failed to come to terms over a new Red Devils contract. But reports in Italy suggest he is closing in on a move to Italian side Fiorentina.
Real Sociedad have warned Liverpool that Martin Zubimendi isn't a Reds player - yet.
The Spanish midfielder has been strongly linked with a move to Anfield over recent days. And the Reds have put him right at the top of their shopping list.
But Sociedad have had a little bit of fun by putting the midfielder front and centre in the team graphic for their latest pre-season friendly.

headline: Ivan Toney signs for £40m, Jadon Sancho rejects PSG - Man Utd's dream front threes
body: Manchester United have already spent £36million to sign Joshua Zirkzee from Bologna in order to improve their attack but Erik ten Hag still isn't satisfied with his options
Manchester United haven't given up hope of signing £40million-rated Ivan Toney - and he could drastically change their attack.

Toney, 28, has entered the final year of his contract at current club Brentford, who'd be willing to do business at around £40million. The England international has frequently been linked with a move to Old Trafford, although United's decision to spend £36m on Bologna striker Joshua Zirkzee in July looked to have signalled the end of their pursuit.

But it soon emerged that the Red Devils wanted to sign another striker in the summer transfer window, a desire which has grown since Rasmus Hojlund was recently ruled out for the first few weeks of the season, leaving Zirkzee as the only senior option up front. Due to representing the Netherlands at Euro 2024, however, the Dutchman didn't feature in any of United's pre-season friendlies and is unlikely to start in Saturday's Community Shield game against bitter rivals Manchester City.

That limits Erik ten Hag's options for now but if United can get Toney over the line, there's a variety of ways which they could set up for the 2024-25 Premier League season. Mirror Football looks at what Ten Hag's dream front three could be - and some more.

Jadon Sancho has had such a stop-start career at Old Trafford that the £73million winger could well feel like a new signing this season. Having buried the hatchet with Ten Hag after helping Borussia Dortmund reach the Champions League final while on loan there, he's hungry to make himself a regular for United three years after first arriving.

His style of play would compliment Marcus Rashford's more direct approach on the left wing, with the Red Devils hero desperate to silence his critics after also missing out on Euro 2024 like Sancho. Neither have played alongside Toney before but the Brentford talisman's physical presence down the middle would allow Rashford and Sancho to run in behind and profit from flick-ons and Toney's acclaimed hold-up play.
Your turn! Who should be in Manchester United's front three? Give us your picks in the comments section

Nothing gets Old Trafford off their feet like a winger rapidly marauding down the flanks, so why not two? Alejandro Garnacho was among Ten Hag's most used players last season and it's hard to believe that he's still only 20. He's certainly deserving of a starting spot and could even challenge Rashford on the left flank if Sancho - or one of Amad or Antony - gets the nod on the right.

The common setup during their dismal 2023-24 campaign, scoring goals certainly wasn't United's biggest issue last season when these three were on the pitch together. The problem for Ten Hag was injuries and that's what prompted him to look for two new strikers who can take the burden off Hojlund.
At 21, the Dane could learn from being team-mates with the more experienced Toney, who also showed for England that he's capable of making an impact as a substitute.

For the vast majority of Ten Hag's reign, he's stuck with a 4-2-3-1 formation and had two wingers flanking one striker. But at times last season, the ex-Ajax boss used a 4-4-2 diamond both in and out possession, with Bruno Fernandes sometimes finding himself as the No.9 and Scott McTominay sitting slightly deeper, such as in May's FA Cup final victory.

So, given that Zirkzee recently admitted that he's a 'nine-and-a-half', how about playing him alongside Toney (or Hojlund) with Fernandes pulling the strings in behind? Mason Mount and Kobbie Mainoo both have the all-round attributes to operate as shuttling midfielders, and McTominay previously played as one under Ole Gunnar Solskjaer.
The formation would also offer Casemiro more protection in the No.6 role ahead of what's set to be a make-or-break season for many at Old Trafford.

headline: Worst Premier League title defences as 115 charges tipped to derail Man City hopes
body: Premier League champions often go into a new season with the most expectation but Michael Owen believes Manchester City will drop down to fourth under Pep Guardiola
Manchester City are seeking an unprecedented fifth successive Premier League title this season.

Pep Guardiola and co just made history by winning four on the bounce, but Michael Owen doesn't think they'll even be in the hunt, let alone retain their crown this term. In fact the former Liverpool man reckons the champions will finish fourth - quite the fall from grace.

He's cited the distractions around the 115 charges levied against them, although that hasn't been an issue for them as of yet. Owen though boldly suggested: "If City are not gonna be really in the race after 10 games then their priority could go elsewhere - I think there could be a big surprise this season.
"They’ve also got the investigation hanging over them and Pep Guardiola is not going to be there forever. This could be his last season."
Guardiola's relentless standards have allowed the Manchester outfit to stay top of the pile. Since winning the title in 2018 they've not finished lower than second.

That hasn't always been the case for champion sides though. After scaling the mountain some have dropped off more than others. It is easy to tip the holders for another impressive year, but for a variety of reasons some teams fall off a cliff.
In light of Owen's comments, which if true would be quite the prediction, we take a look at Premier League champions who faced a drop off the year after they lifted the trophy.

Those at Ewood Park cherished their moment in the sun, but it didn't last long. Alan Shearer landed his only title win at Anfield on a dramatic final day. But Manchester United, the team who had finished second, soon wrestled back their crown as Blackburn slumped to a seventh place finish.

Their success was built on the fortunes of Jack Walker, their owner who had thrown huge sums at the playing group. They eventually finished seventh the following year - and were as low as 15th after eight games of the campaign. They had managed to retain the majority of their winning outfit, but after a failed title defence they all begun seeking pastures new.

Sir Alex Ferguson was out and David Moyes was in. An opening day victory at Swansea was as good as the feeling got as it quickly became apparent this United side had perhaps overachieved by winning the title, owing a lot to the goals of Robin van Persie.

Moyes was hailed as the Chosen One, but he failed to last the season before he was given the sack. United were embarrassed at Old Trafford by Liverpool and City, who both secured 3-0 wins. Come early December they were ninth having won just five of their first 15 matches. In truth, the Red Devils have never truly found their feet since the Scot's exit and their demise that year was a sign of the struggles that were to come.

Whilst some drop offs you can see coming, this one was a bolt of lightning no one forecasted. Jose Mourinho seemed to be at the peak of his powers and had breezed to another title triumph, but an opening day draw with Swansea, marred by a clash with the club's physio, set about a series of events that led to Mourinho's demise.

At the halfway stage of the season the Blues were in a genuine relegation scrap. Mourinho had claimed the club would have to sack their most successful ever manager before he said his work was "betrayed" after losing to Leicester - shortly before he was given the chop.
Gus Hiddink led them to the end of the season as they replaced Blackburn by posting, statistically, the worst ever season as defending champions by ending up in tenth.

Plenty will argue their tag of Premier League champions - whilst remarkable and an incredible narrative - wasn't exactly a fair gauge of the club and its players. They also lost N'Golo Kante, arguably their best player, after winning the title so were certainly hampered.

A loss to newly promoted Hull on the opening day was a sign of things to come as Claudio Ranieri went from hero to zero, receiving his marching orders in February after five successive losses left them in 17th. Craig Shakespeare helped lead a resurgence that eventually led them to mid-table after the threat of relegation appeared very real.

Another Blues blow up under an outspoken coach, this time Antonio Conte. The Italian had broken numerous records in his debut season en route to the title. However swiftly things turned sour as there was talk of Conte walking away before a ball was kicked ahead of his second season.

A 3-2 home loss to Burnley, who had led 3-0, on the opening day set a sour tone. Chelsea secured some notable wins but there was an undertone of an angered Conte, who publicly challenged the club to match his ambition after missing out on transfer targets. A home hammering at the hands of Bournemouth was among the lowest points.
FA Cup success at Wembley salvaged some silverware but eventually the Blues finished in fifth meaning they missed out on the Champions League for the first time in the Roman Abramovich era.

headline: Man City vs Manchester United: New referee named for Community Shield as FA make change
body: A new referee has been appointed for this weekend's Community Shield match between Manchester United and Manchester City after the FA were forced to pull out original official John Brooks
Jarred Gillett will be the man in the middle for the Community Shield on Saturday, when Manchester United face Manchester City at Wembley.
John Brooks had been set to take charge of the match but was forced to excuse himself due to injury just three days before the match.

As such, Gillet, who was initially set to be the fourth official for the match, has now been promoted due. Sam Barrott has replaced him as the fourth official, while Adrian Holmes and Nick Greenhalgh will be Gillett's assistants.

Peter Bankes will be on VAR duty at Stockley Park, with Sian Massey-Ellis and Tim Robinson supporting him in the season's traditional curtain raiser, as Premier League champions City take on FA Cup winners United.

United, who beat City in the FA Cup Final in the pair's last meeting, will look to lay down a marker ahead of the new season, as they seek to ensure there's no repeat of last season's eighth place finish in the Premier League.

But Erik ten Hag be without new big-money signing Leny Yoro, with the centre-back sidelined for three months with a foot injury. United's Dutch boss is confident it won't be long before supporters see the best of the young Frenchman however, telling Sky Sports: “A fire is burning. As I say, for his age, he is already very mature and very balanced.
"I’m sure he will be returning as soon as possible to help the team. He’s already started his rehab."

City have a clean bill of health, but star midfielder Rodri is set to miss out. The 28-year-old has been enjoying an extended holiday after winning Euro 2024 with Spain and has yet to return to action.

headline: Erik ten Hag advised on Ruud van Nistelrooy amid fears he could take his Man Utd job
body: Ruud van Nistelrooy has been tipped to take over from Erik ten Hag at Manchester United, but Gordon Strachan doesn't believe the Dutchman is a threat to his compatriot
Gordon Strachan doesn't think Erik ten Hag regards Ruud van Nistelrooy as a threat to his future at Manchester United.

Ten Hag, 54, put pen to paper on a contract extension this year despite leading United to an underwhelming eighth-place finish in the Premier League last term. He brought the Van Nistelrooy on board after winning the FA Cup against Manchester City as part of major changes to his backroom staff, which saw Steve McLaren and Mitchell van der Gaag leave Old Trafford.

There had been rumours the club were on the look to replace Ten Hag, but they ultimately decided to stick with the under-fire boss, who welcomed former Go Ahead Eagles manager Rene Hake alongside Van Nistelrooy onto his new-look staff, reports the Manchester Evening News.
However, speaking to topoffshorecasinos.com, Strachan dismissed any speculation that Van Nistelrooy could step into Ten Hag's role in the near future.

"No, I don't think that Erik ten Hag will be looking at Ruud van Nistelrooy and thinking to himself that man wants my job," the Scotsman said. "You can't be looking over your shoulder as a manager, that's the last thing you would do. I think it would be far too obvious if the club are thinking about replacing Ten Hag with Ruud van Nistelrooy. It would be too transparent."

He shared his own experience, saying: "As a manager, it's just another part of the job that he has to deal with. I've managed clubs where certain players have really close relationships with the hierarchy of executives, and you just have to get on with it."

However, Strachan also expressed scepticism about the potential appointment: "I just can't see the people who are calling the shots appointing van Nistelrooy if things turn sour. It's like having a burglar sitting in the dugout wearing a balaclava and a hooped shirt carrying a swag bag."

Van Nistelrooy's first competitive game in the United dugout will come on Saturday. The Red Devils face Manchester City in the Community Shield – the traditional curtain raiser to the season – in a repeat of the FA Cup final from just a few months ago.

headline: Why Man Utd's Chido Obi-Martin signing hasn't gone through yet
body: Manchester United are attempting to get a deal over the line for Arsenal’s promising youngster Chido Obi-Martin but the move still hasn’t gone through despite just weeks remaining of the window
Manchester United look set to steal an Arsenal wonderkid from right under the Gunners’ noses - but there's still work to do.
The Red Devils have been busy in the summer transfer busy so far having signed both Leny Yoro and Joshua Zirkzee for significant fees. However, there is another exciting bit of business in the works.

Man United have been linked with a move for Arsenal’s youngster Chido Obi-Martin. The 16-year-old striker had become one of the most exciting starlets to come out of the Gunners’ academy over recent years having plundered 32 goals among the under-18s last term. Even better, he was available at the end of his Arsenal contract.

While it appears that a deal should be straightforward given he is a free agent, there has been a significant delay in getting the youngster through the door. According to The Athletic, the delay is down to Man United being locked into negotiations with Arsenal.

While Obi-Martin is a free agent, the Red Devils still have to pay a compensation fee due to his age. It is suggested that talks are anticipated to end in an agreement without the need for negotiations to go to a tribunal.

The deal will then go through a formal Premier League ratification process, which could take a few weeks. Once the move is approved, it is expected that Obi-Martin will go into Man United’s under-18 side, with the potential to move into the under-21 group.

Depending on how he performs, he could then potentially be given the opportunity to train with the club’s first-team. Man United were not the only side linked with him, with Bayern Munich also interested but the Red Devils look likely to win the race for his signature.
The move would be a significant coup for Ten Hag given how highly rated Obi-Martin is. Speaking about his talents, ex-Arsenal star and now academy coach Jack Wilshere said: "He's been exceptional.

“I've said it before but credit to everyone at the club and at Hale End for the work that they have done with him. He's adapted so well, helped the team massively at times. Also, credit to his teammates too because they serve him so well, and he's grateful for that."
Away from Obi-Martin, Man United chiefs are still working on adding a new midfielder to the squad. Sander Berge of Burnley has emerged as an option over recent days.

headline: Man Utd transfer targets all have one thing in common as next Erik ten Hag signing emerges
body: Manchester United are on the hunt for a new midfielder and Erik ten Hag looks to have a specific type of player in mind with three targets all being praised for their character
Erik ten Hag appears to be on the hunt for a specific kind of midfield signing - with character seemingly king at Manchester United.

The Red Devils have had a new holding midfielder on their wishlist all summer long, with several options linked in recent weeks. PSG's Manuel Ugarte emerged as a primary target, but negotiations have stalled over the £51million-rated Uruguayan.
With that move hanging in balance, the net has been cast wider as Ten Hag, gearing up for his third campaign in charge at Old Trafford, eyes other options. And there's a common theme amongst them.
Palmeiras' Richard Rios, Atalanta's Ederson and Burnley's Sander Berge have each previously been praised for not only their talents but also their exemplary attitudes.
Colombian international Rios had his praises sung by Palmeiras boss Abel Ferreira after a 3-0 win over Fortaleza last season.
"He's a good player who helps us," lauded Ferreira. "When I look at a player it isn't just about his technique, it's about tactics, physicality, mentality and character. He has a good character."

Ederson, meanwhile, has also caught Liverpool's eye after a standout season in Serie A, culminating in Europa League glory. His ex-Corinthians manager Tiago Nunes was full of compliments for his technical prowess and rock-solid mindset, Nunes said: "My first impressions were of a player with a lot of strength, a lot of physical ability, a player who was a powerful striker on the ball, with good technique. Basically, someone with characteristics that are difficult to find, especially in Brazilian football.

"He has two main strengths. Firstly, on the pitch, he has great physical strength, with the ability to play box-to-box, back and forth, sustaining the pace of the game. Secondly, he has a very strong mentality, with a very clear awareness of what he wants.

"I see him playing as a box-to-box player, a midfielder who isn't really someone to build the game but more of a player who can break through lines, get into the final third, progress up the field. I see him more as a midfielder with the freedom to get forward."
In similar fashion, Burnley's Berge received accolades for his on-field attitude from former Sheffield United boss Paul Heckingbottom, who hailed: "Football-wise, he's been great all the time.

"We told him there was goals in this game for him, and he got half a yard and got a shot off. He's been performing like that all the time, scoring goals since day one, and I can't speak highly enough of him.

"We love him here. Not just as a footballer; he's a fantastic person and you can see what we think of him. His performances on the pitch are great but how he carries himself is even better and we're delighted to still have him."

Regardless of who Ten Hag ends up having at his disposal for the new season, it seems certain they'll bring a high level of professionalism to the dressing room - something that appears to have been sorely missing in recent years at the club.

headline: Premier League 2024 pre-season friendlies, dates, fixtures and results for all 20 clubs
body: Many Premier League sides are venturing over the Atlantic in the coming weeks to play pre-season friendlies in America before getting their campaign under way in mid-August
The Premier League is almost ready to roar back into action.

headline: Man Utd wonderkid who clashed with team-mate ruled out with 'freak' injury
body: Manchester United youngster Dan Gore remains absent from training after undergoing surgery on a shoulder injury - which he picked up during a personal training session
Manchester United's Dan Gore has still not returned to training after suffering a freak shoulder injury.

The young midfielder was hoping to further stake his case under Erik ten Hag having been one of several youth prospects who were included in last summer's pre-season tour. He missed out this year though after dislocating his shoulder during a personal training session

Gore required surgery at the beginning of June and is yet to return to training at Carrington as he continues his recovery from the freak injury with his pre-season being disrupted as a result. A loan move was touted as an option but his lack of fitness may cost him.

The window will soon close and a switch in January now looks more likely, reports the MEN. United need to decide on how they will handle the player's long-term development after Gore spent the last six months of last season on loan with Port Vale, before disaster struck after just one appearance when he sustained his injury.

The teenager has more than proved he's willing to put himself about and mix it with established stars in order to further his own career. Back in Ten Hag's first season he was involved in a brief training ground bust up with Anthony Martial after Frenchman took issue with his aggressiveness.

They were forced to temporarily halt a training session for non-World Cup players at Carrington which also featured a number of youth-team stars were also drafted in. Gore clattered Martial with a robust tackle, which sparked an angry confrontation between the pair.

Martial is alleged to have lashed out and caught the teenager, who is said to have stood his ground against the former first-team star. They had to be pulled apart, with Gore told by Ten Hag and his staff that tackling first-team stars was off-limits in training games.

Ten Hag handed Gore his debut on his 19th birthday as he came off the bench during a 3-0 win over Crystal Palace. The United was keen to shut down suggestions the debut was in any way a ‘gift’ for the teenager - insisting he deserved his shot.

He said: “It’s a good birthday for him, but I’m not a coach who gives opportunities to players [for no reason], they have to earn it. Once they earn it, they have their chance. They have to earn it every day in training. I don’t hand opportunities to young players. They must consistently prove their worth in training because if they don’t, it can affect the team."

headline: Man Utd 'still interested' in signing Premier League forward after Rasmus Hojlund injury
body: Manchester United are considering a move for Ivan Toney as his Brentford contract winds down and the Bees consider offloading him for a reasonable fee that could interest the Red Devils
Manchester United have not totally given up on landing Ivan Toney as they weigh up their options.

The Red Devils are among those to be linked with the Brentford frontman, who only has 12 months left on his deal in west London. The Bees want to maximise their profits and have previously quoted a hefty fee - which did put off potential suitors.

But with time no longer on their side Brentford may have to drop their price and United themselves are considering reinforcements in that area following the injury to Rasmus Hojlund, who could be out for two months. Erik ten Hag also wants to ensure he has some experience in the final third with Toney having proven himself as a Premier League marksman.

The forward has been able to make the step up from the Championship with his exploits in the top flight earning him England recognition. In both his full Premier League campaigns he's hit double figures.

Forbes claim that Brentford would now be willing to do business for around £40million - a price that may tempt those at Old Trafford as they look to ensure they are well resourced in their forward line ahead of the new season.

“We are always looking,” Ten Hag has said about the club making new signings. “This new leadership team is really eager to do business. To make deals. They are on it. But we have to wait if the timing is there, if the opportunities are there. I can’t say in this moment but I am sure when they are there, we will go forward.”

Last term a huge burden was placed on Hojlund despite his lack of experience. The Dane was signed with a long-term view in mind but was immediately asked to lead the line on his own, failing to score a league goal until Boxing Day.

His injury leaves Ten Hag light, albeit he has signed Dutchman Joshua Zirkzee. The former Bologna man is not and out and out forward but is not yet up to match sharpness as United consider playing in this weekend's Community Shield with either Jadon Sancho or Bruno Fernandes as a striker.

Ten Hag said: "That is what we can do if we don’t have the availability of Rasmus. Of course, Joshua Zirkzee is coming in. He has started training. But he is not so long in training so it it will take time and he has to adjust to English football and our way of playing. Jadon can, of course, play as a striker. He can also play in wide areas but it could be that he is a good option."

headline: Man Utd transfer news: Erik ten Hag considers loan signing U-turn as familiar problem returns
body: Manchester United continue to pursue midfield recruits with Sofyan Amrabat potentially remain at Old Trafford as stadium plans continue to be drawn up by club bosses
Manchester United have had an active summer and with the season less than a fortnight away we could see yet more movement.

The Red Devils have already landed two signings in the form of Joshua Zirkzee and Leny Yoro, but an injury blow to the latter could force the club back into the market. Recruits are being considered in all areas as INEOS look to make an impact in their first full season.

They opted to stick by Erik ten Hag and he has been surrounded by competent individuals as Sir Jim Ratcliffe puts the club in an ideal position for success. The British billionaire also has grand plans away from the pitch as he looks to further improvement United's infrastructure.
Here's the latest from Manchester.

The Red Devils plan to keep Old Trafford and downsize it if they opt to build a new stadium on land next door. The Old Trafford redevelopment project are looking to reduce their current home as they plot to build a new £2billion, 100,000-capacity, state-of-the-art stadium.

There is a desire from those involved at the Manchester to create “the Wembley of the north “ and - should that go ahead - the plan is for Old Trafford, which can currently hold 74,310 fans, to be scaled down to a capacity of around 30,000 to 35,000.

The reduced arena would then be used as a stadium for United’s women’s team as well as the club’s various academy teams. There is a desire from those involved to maintain the history and the heritage that has been created at their long-term home.
Among features to be preserved in a potentially scaled-down Old Trafford would include the Munich clock and the central tunnel on the halfway line, which players used to use in the past.

Ten Hag has not ruled out moving for Sofyan Amrabat before the end of this summer's transfer window, but landing him permanently on this occasion. The Moroccan moved from Fiorentina 12 months ago but only joined on loan following an impressive World Cup.

United have the option to make their loan deal for Ambrabat a permanent one - and that is being considered, reports the Telegraph. There are concerns over the original fee agreed for the player, who was plagued by injury and didn't produce his best form.

The club are desperate to strengthen their midfield ranks ahead of the window closing later this month and they are being linked with a plethora of options as a deal for Ugarte looking increasingly unlikely given PSG's price demands.

Another midfield on the United radar is Sander Berge, who they were linked with way back in 2020 before he eventually moved to Sheffield United. Last summer he made the switch to Burnley but could be on the move once more after their relegation.

The Sun reports that after making contact with Berge’s representatives, the Red Devils were informed that the Clarets wanted £30m for the Norway international. United are only willing to pay £20m for the midfielder, who was signed from Sheffield United for £12m last summer.

The Old Trafford hierarchy have continued to run into issues when targeting players this summer. Several potential sellers have quoted hefty prices and refused to come down. That has also been an issue in United's pursuit of Jarrad Branthwaite with Everton demanding £70m.

headline: Erik ten Hag told he'll be sacked by Man Utd by Christmas because "he hasn't got the chops"
body: Erik ten Hag was under huge pressure during a crisis-hit campaign last season that saw his Man United side suffer woeful spells of form as they went on to finish eighth in the Premier League
Erik ten Hag won't make it past Christmas at Manchester United this season because he "hasn't got the chops", according to talkSPORT presenter Simon Jordan.

The Dutchman was under huge pressure during a crisis-hit campaign last season that saw his side suffer spells of woeful form as they went on to finish eighth in the Premier League - but he was given a stay of execution after winning the FA Cup, despite the club holding talks with Thomas Tuchel.
New United chief Sir Jim Ratcliffe is conducting a radical overhaul of the club with Omar Berrada installed as the new CEO, while Dan Ashworth has arrived as sporting director.

"They're going to alter the landscape and put some more support in and Ratcliffe has said you can't judge a coach if the framework behind him isn't perfect," he said on his talkSPORT show. "Well you can judge the coach for some of the things that come out of his mouth and some of the ridiculousness you have to listen to.

"And I get it, that when you're dealing with the media you play a certain game and say certain things. "But I don't think he's got the chops - Danny [Murphy] sat here last year and said, 'There's no way Man United can play Bruno Fernandes and Christian Eriksen in the same midfield, people will go through them like a knife through butter.'

"One thing Man United were last year was easy to play against. If you've got a very cute football observer sitting in the punditry observing this, the guy that's at the Sharpe End must be able to see the same thing. I don't think Ten Hag has the chops for it."

"I think it's a difficult job, he's a capable operator at a certain level, and I think Man United is a hugely difficult beast to tame. But that doesn't alter the parameters of that's what you're there to do."
Jordan went on to say that winning the FA Cup was a "get out of jail card" and didn't prove that he was a good enough manager for United.

A tough season for Ten Hag saw him deal with off the field issues involving Mason Greenwood, Antony and Jadon Sancho before seeing his side dumped out of the Champions League at the group stage. He also oversaw some horror performances, including a 3-0 loss at home to Bournemouth and coming close to losing to Coventry in the FA Cup semi-finals.

The former Ajax boss has attempted to rebuild with two key signings - forward Joshua Zirkzee from Bayern and Leny Yoro from Lille, though the young defender has dealt the Dutchman a huge blow with news he faces three months on the sidelines with injury.
United have been on pre-season in the US and lost 3-0 to Liverpool in a friendly last time out - with Ten Hag now preparing for the Community Shield against rivals Man City on Saturday.

headline: Kieran Trippier could switch Premier League clubs as a result of Man Utd transfer failure
body: Kieran Trippier has been linked with a Manchester United move in the past but could find himself on the move elsewhere as an indirect result of United's summer business
West Ham could turn their attention to Kieran Trippier after hitting a roadblock in their pursuit of Manchester United's Aaron Wan-Bissaka, it hsa been claimed.

Wan-Bissaka is one of a number of full-backs eyed up by Hammers boss Julen Lopetegui after the club lost Ben Johnson to Ipswich. Noussair Mazraoui was targeted only for a deal to fall through, while no progress has been made in their efforts to land Southampton man Kyle Walker-Peters.

Lopetegui has already made several new additions to his squad. Crysencio Summerville, Niclas Fullkrug and Guido Rodriguez have moved to the London Stadium in the last week, joining Luiz Guilherme, Wes Foderingham and Max Kilman.
Trippier could be next. The England international, who featured during the run to the Euro 2024 final, is in the final year of his Newcastle contract and could be allowed to leave.

According to The Telegraph, West Ham have yet to receive an answer on Trippier's availability. However, he's understood to be one of the full-back options on their radar, while there is also interest from clubs in Saudi Arabia.

West Ham have also been linked with German international centre-back Mats Hummels, who is a free agent after leaving Borussia Dortmund. Brighton are also keen on the 35-year-old, who scored in last season's Champions League semi-finals.

New manager Lopetegui, who replaced David Moyes following the end of the 2023-24 season, has made clear the size of the task ahead. The Hammer, who kick off their Premier League campaign against Aston Villa on August 17, lost both games on their pre-season tour of the US against Wolves and Crystal Palace.

"We have 15 days to keep working and keep going to put the team in the best way for the first step that is, of course, the first Premier League match against Aston Villa," Lopetegui said after the Palace game. West Ham went in level at the break in Tampa, but two goals inside five second-half minutes gave Palace victory.

"Of course, we have to improve on a lot of things and I think maybe more or less the same as the Wolves game, until 60 minutes we have been balanced in the match," he added. "After, we have to analyse and ensure we are able to do better, to defend better and don’t concede easy goals. I think we have to change this.

"We are working hard and we know that we have worked very, very hard, so it’s possible that the legs were a little bit tired, so I think we have two days until we go back to London, then we will start the new week with new energy knowing that we have one other friendly match in our stadium to be ready for the key date which is Aston Villa."

headline: Man City vs Man Utd: FA forced into last minute referee change ahead of Community Shield
body: A new referee has been appointed for this weekend's Community Shield match between Manchester United and Manchester City, with the FA announcing Jarred Gillett as the new official
The FA have been forced to name a new referee for the Community Shield clash between Manchester United and Manchester City.

John Brooks was set to take charge of the match at Wembley, but he has suffered a minor injury and has now been removed from the fixture just three days before it is due to take place. Jarred Gillett has replaced him.

Gillett was initially set to be the fourth official for the match, but has now been promoted due to Brooks' injury. Sam Barrott has replaced him as the fourth official, while Adrian Holmes and Nick Greenhalgh will be Gillett's assistants.

Peter Bankes will be on VAR duty at Stockley Park, with Sian Massey-Ellis and Tim Robinson supporting him. The Community Shield acts as the traditional curtain raiser ahead of the new season, with Premier League champions City taking on FA Cup winners United.
United will be without new signing Leny Yoro, with the centre-back sidelined for three months with a foot injury, and striker Rasmus Hojlund. Left-back Tyrell Malacia remains a long-term absentee.

City, meanwhile, appear to have a clean bill of health, but star midfielder Rodri could miss the game. The 28-year-old has been enjoying an extended break from football after winning Euro 2024 with Spain and has yet to return to action.

The game will be the first competitive fixture for both side's since last season's FA Cup final, which United won 2-1. Alejandro Garnacho and Kobbie Mainoo were on target for the Red Devils, while Jeremy Doku scored a late goal for City.

The win also saw United qualify for the Europa League and ensured they ended the season on a high, having recorded their worst-ever Premier League finish. Reflecting on the win over City, United boss Erik ten Hag said at the time: "All compliments to the team.

"We played very good to our identity. Very strong. You have seen how we can play when we have the players on board. Some were not even match fit but the performance was very good. I tell you this all year - when the players are fit we can play good football.

"A very good performance against the best team in the world. With a local rivalry it's there and it's much more important when you play a team from your own city. But for us it wasn't about this, it was to prove a point after so many setbacks. The team showed so much resilience and I'm proud of them."

Harry Maguire was left out of the Liverpool match as a precaution and fellow centre back Victor Lindelof was taken off at half-time for similar reasons. United could. also be without full backs Aaron Wan-Bissaka and Luke Shaw.

"Harry Maguire missed the game (against Liverpool), was a precaution but is still a question mark for Saturday," Ten Hag said. "So we have training, we have to see whether he is fit enough or not to be available.
